The [following tutorial contains instructions and a video walk through](https://learnr-examples.shinyapps.io/ex-setup-r/) for installing R, RStudio, and the `tidyverse` -- an R *verse* consisting of a few packages that ease data importation, management (including dates and categorical variables), wrangling, and visualization.  

You can find R from here by navigating in accordance with your operating system. If you work on a Mac, be careful about the different versions that depend on the underlying hardward [Apple Silicon (ARM64) versus Intel Macs] [Link](https://cran.r-project.org/)

If you skip the above step, the download page for RStudio will remind you that you RStudio requires R. [The download page can be found here.](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)
